name: Ted Cruz
caption:
The Jewish people will come together this evening to light candles beginning the eight days of observance of Hanukkah, the Festival of Lights, and remember the great miracle that happened in Israel. This holiday celebrates the heroic revolt and triumph of the Maccabees, who liberated the historic land of Judea, rededicated the Second Temple in Jerusalem, and restored the right to worship freely. It is fitting that this year Hanukkah comes against the backdrop of the one-year anniversary of the United States acknowledging Jerusalem as Israelâ€™s capital, and it will also be the first Hanukkah since we moved our embassy to its rightful place there.
Heidi and I wish the Jewish people a very Happy Hanukkah.

caption:
Across America, families, friends, and loved ones gather together to reflect and celebrate the blessings of liberty. We thank God for our country, which is a beacon of freedom for the world, and for the generations of men and women who have stood, and continue to stand ready to defend it. This tradition of gratitude, first practiced by the Pilgrims following their courageous journey to the New World, has been woven into the very fabric of our nation.
In Texas, weâ€™ve made long strides on the road to recovery in the first year since Hurricane Harvey. And though we have faced other natural disasters and heartbreaking hardships, Texans have stood strong and persevered. The renowned â€˜can-doâ€™ spirit of our state and compassion of our communities has kept us strong. For that, among many other blessings, we can be immensely thankful. #HappyThanksgiving

name: Ted Cruz
caption: This Veterans Day, we pause to honor the selfless service and unyielding courage of the men and women of our Armed Forces. We say â€˜thank youâ€™ to every brave soldier, sailor, airman, marine, and coast guardsman who pledge themselves to the defense of our nation, our Constitution, and our way of life. The Lone Star State is home to 1.6 million veterans, and our home has a rich tradition of military service. From Fort Bliss to Red River Army Depot, from Sheppard Air Force Base to Naval Air Station Kingsville, Texas is proud to stand as a pillar in Americaâ€™s national security. We especially honor the memory of millions of Americans, including 200,000 Texans, who served in World War I, a conflict of such devastation that its victorious end became a national holiday eventually dedicated to all Veterans: Armistice Day. On the 11th hour, of the 11th day, of the 11th month of 1918, the last guns of the Western Front went silent. One hundred years later, the sacrifice of those who sang â€˜we won't come back â€˜til it's over, over thereâ€™ resounds across the ages, answered with gratitude and fond remembrance in every American heart.

name: Ted Cruz
caption:
For six decades, @nasa has enabled the United States to lead the world in space exploration. I am proud of the work that has been accomplished across NASA and by the dedicated men and women at @nasajohnson. NASA has an incredible legacy of bravery and success that has been pivotal to the United States in winning the space race, making new discoveries throughout our solar system, and preparing to send manned missions to Mars and beyond. As chairman of the Subcommittee on Space, Science, and Competitiveness, I am committed to strengthening our national space program so that NASAâ€™s success of the last 60 years will be continued for decades to come. I am optimistic about the work ahead to open up the last frontier, as NASA continues its research and development to support the goals of our national space program.

Dwight Eisenhower appointed pro-choice Justices William Brennan (1956) and Potter Stewart (1958) to the Supreme Court. As Governor of California Ronald Reagan legalized abortion in the state when he signed the Therapeutic Abortion Act on June 14, 1967. Governor Nelson Rockefeller of New York signed legislation legalizing abortion from a Republican controlled state legislature in 1970. President Richard Nixon appointed pro-choice Justices Warren Burger (1969), Harry Blackmun (1970), and Lewis Powell (1971) to the Supreme Court. Roe v. Wade was decided on January 22, 1973 with 5 Republican appointed Justices voting in favor of it (Brennan, Stewart, Burger, Blackmun and Powell). President Gerald Ford admitted to being pro-choice and made Nelson Rockefeller his Vice President. Ford appointed pro-choice Justice John Paul Stevens to the Supreme Court in 1975. Ronald Reagan appointed pro-choice Justice Sandra Day O'Connor in 1981 who was also confirmed by a Republican controlled Senate. Reagan also appointed pro-choice Justice Anthony Kennedy in 1988. George H.W. Bush appointed pro-choice David Souter to the highest court in 1990. Roe v. Wade was further solidified as precedence in Planned Parenthood v. Casey on June 29, 1992. Republican appointed Justices Blackmun, Stevens, O'Connor, Kennedy and Souter voted in favor of the Casey decision that upheld Roe. The Republicans legalized abortion through the state legislative process and through case law in the federal courts. name: Ted Cruz
caption:
Americaâ€™s resolve was greatly tested on a dark morning 17 years ago. Nearly 3,000 innocent lives were taken by the evil of terrorism.
Today, we honor their memory. We remember the men and women in the World Trade Center, and those first responders â€“ firefighters, law enforcement officials, and Good Samaritans â€“ who rushed to their aid. We remember the military and civilian personnel in the Pentagon whose important work continues to keep our country safe. And we remember the innocent passengers and crewmembers on those four flights, some of whom heroically sacrificed themselves to minimize the casualties on the ground.
As we honor those lost, and those who rushed into harmâ€™s way to save others, we also reaffirm our commitment to defend America from radical Islamic terrorism.
After 17 years of conflict in Afghanistan, Iraq, and elsewhere around the globe, we pause to express our deep gratitude for the service and sacrifice of our military and the intelligence community who work tirelessly to prevent additional attacks from occurring on our soil.
As our freedoms and very way of life came under attack, American courage and strength prevailed. May we never forget those lost, and the service of our brave men and women in uniform who continue to fight day and night to keep our nation free and secure.
